ycparak

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## PKMS {#pkms dir="auto" tabindex="-1"}

[](#pkms){#user-content-pkms aria-label="Permalink: PKMS"}

Note taking system inspired by [Andy Matuschak's notes](https://notes.andymatuschak.org/About_these_notes){rel="nofollow"}, built with Vue and Nuxt.js.

As an interface paradigm, horizontal panning seems to me to encourage ephemeral rabbit hole consumption, I think this takes advantage of that, and intuitevly feels like it holds higher end-user retentention. OTOH, I think that it possibly comes at the expense of deeper knowledge study / understanding.

[![5](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/12952566/335468308-12a3ccfb-bb77-4f86-92c5-b179e31d5a25.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..Y_9bVuYLd9sHgUMNjEyTty-mppbuzsCTPaprJ2mlml0)](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/12952566/335468308-12a3ccfb-bb77-4f86-92c5-b179e31d5a25.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..Y_9bVuYLd9sHgUMNjEyTty-mppbuzsCTPaprJ2mlml0){rel="noopener noreferrer"}

## Use {#use dir="auto" tabindex="-1"}

[](#use){#user-content-use aria-label="Permalink: Use"}

    # install dependencies
    $ npm install

    # serve with hot reload at localhost:3000
    $ npm run dev

    # build for production and launch server
    $ npm run build
    $ npm run start

    # generate static project
    $ npm run generate

For detailed explanation on how things work, check out [Nuxt.js docs](https://nuxtjs.org/){rel="nofollow"}.
